content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good challenge for a Clash of Code, solvable in less than 5 minutes.
Great! Solved fast on js, but it took a few moment to think!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: ok, clean

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The challenge is clear and is solvable in less than 5 minutes.

Input section
* Please change "Each student, the input contains their" to "Space-separated input containing each student's".

Output section
* Please format "N lines" in <<bold>>.

* Please mention that the grade should be output as well.

Constraints section
* Plase mention the lower limit of the length of [[name]] (i.e. 1).

* Please mention that [[name]] is always one word and does not contain any space characters.

Thanks.

Some suggestions :)

*Input:
   - add, in bold, which line it is -> <<Line 1>>: A positive integer [[N]
   - move the constraints for the inputs to the constraints section -> 1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 1000
   - Add a note saying that [[score]] will be an integer(since I don't see it being a float in the test cases)

*output:
    - <<Next [[K]] Lines>>: [[name]] [[avgScore]] [[letterGrade]] --> This I am a bit uncertain about because this seems a bit weird, but the current description for output is not very clear. We can see what 5DN1L thinks about this
   - move the grading scale to the goal area

*Stub generator:
   - You can consider changing the input style from a "[[name]] {{scores in [[k]] subjects}}" to "[[name]] [[k]]" then loop [[k]] to get each score, so in the stub generator that would be a double for loop. Below is code written in not a particular coding language to help you visualize what I mean. I feel like that maybe this would be a bit easier to work with, but this one really depends on you.
int N = readInput()
for(int i = 0; i<N;i++){
   string input = readInput().split(' ')
   string name = input[0]
   int k = input[1]
   for(int j = 0; j<k;j++) {
      int score = readInput()
   }
}


This is a cool clash! I'm looking forward to seeing it in action!

The letter grade F never shows up in your tests and validators, what's the point of keeping it ?
Moreover, I fear that the precise boundaries between letters may be hard to figure for a reverse, for example, giving the tests, you could observe that B is everything below 91.25 and above 79.99, but that would not pass the last validator. Even if it is more natural to say it's 90, the point is that you can't know for sure.

I totally forgot doing a test with an F, now i have done one.

It is true that it would not be a good exercice for a reverse, so i changed it for fastest and shortest.

Thank you so much ^^

Preciate those suggestions :)

I have changed everything but the stub suggestion.
I kinda prefer the players to be parsing by themselves the input is given, i think it might do it a bit more challenging, because lets be honest, its not a difficult clash. Only by forcing them to parse it, will prevent them to do it in 15 seconds XD

And again thank you so much for the suggestions

Thank you so much!

I have everything you said ^^

Feel free to tell me if there is still anything left to change!
Thank you for making the changes. In Constraints section, please add "and" after "one word".

Thanks Storm_Blackthorn for making the comments some of which I would have made myself :)
I didn't review this clash until just now, and I've left my own comments. The Output section doesn't mention the grade, and that should really be added before anyone approves the clash really :P

No worries! I'm just trying to help out too, but obviously, I am still a bit new and am gonna miss a few things. I try to see what suggestions you give to know what to look out for in other clashes. Thanks for taking your time and helping everyone out!
